betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You're surprised the process of energizing a node is so simple, relatively speaking. Even your old wands could have managed this... though, admittedly, they couldn't have managed moving nodes. And settling a base right on top of one seems comically inefficient.

Place the node stabilizer somewhere, place your jarred node right above it, and place the node transductor right above that. Release the node from it's prison using your wand, and give the transductor a redstone signal. The node's aspects will be drained, and a moment later, energized.

...Carefully reviewing your Thaumonomicon you notice one bit you missed earlier. Applying a redstone signal to the stabilizer will turn off, huh? Perhaps it's worth placing the stabilizer on a floor of hard to break, obviously out of place blocks - obsidian, perhaps - to make sure there are no accidents with either your pickaxe or redstone signals.

You don't know what will happen if stabilization fails while a node is energized, and you're sure you're better off not knowing.

Â§3For the record, the node would violently explode into a giant pool of flux. Try to avoid that outcome, if possible.
